section.p: HPESBMU03895 rev.1 - HPE Real Time Management System (RTMS), Multiple Remote Security Issues NOTICE: The information in this Security Bulletin should be acted upon as soon as possible.
Potential Security Impact: Remote: Arbitrary File Modification, Execution of Arbitrary Code, Execution of Arbitrary Code With Root Privileges
Source: Hewlett Packard Enterprise, HPE Product Security Response Team

section.title: VULNERABILITY SUMMARY
section.p: HPE Real Time Management System (RTMS), versions 2.0,3.0,3.0.14,3.0.20,3.0.21,3.0.30,3.0.40,3.0.41 are vulnerable to remote Arbitrary file modification, execution of code, and execution of code with root privileges.
Note: The problem is addressed in the latest version of RTMS 3.0.50. No patches or updates are available for prior releases.
References: CVE-2018-1002202 - Note: This is a worst case score, based on service being installed and running as root

section.title: SUPPORTED SOFTWARE VERSIONS*: ONLY impacted versions are listed.
section.p: HPE Real Time Management System (RTMS) - 2.0,3.0,3.0.14,3.0.20,3.0.21,3.0.30,3.0.40,3.0.41 - All existing versions are affected, No patches or updates are available for prior releases.

section.title: BACKGROUND
section.p: CVSS Version 3.0 and Version 2.0 Base Metrics
Information on CVSS is documented in HPE Customer Notice: HPSN-2008-002
